RegionCovered.Title: No exposure detected
RegionCovered.Body: You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.
RegionCovered.AllSetBody: Your phone is now running Bluetooth to collect codes from nearby phones.

NoRegion.Title: No exposure detected
NoRegion.Body:
You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

However, in some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report COVID-19 diagnoses through this app.
NoRegion.AllSetBody:
We’ll let you know as soon as people outside Ontario can report a diagnosis through COVID Alert.

It’s still helpful to keep COVID Alert on.

That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll find out if you were near them.

RegionNotCovered.Title: No reporting yet in your area
RegionNotCovered.Body:
People in your province or territory are not yet able to report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

It’s still helpful to turn COVID Alert on. That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll be notified if you were near them.
RegionNotCovered.AllSetBody:
We’ll let you know as soon as people in your area can report a diagnosis through COVID Alert.

It’s still helpful to keep COVID Alert on.

That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, you’ll find out if you were near them.

CA.Title: You’ve been exposed in the last 14 days
CA.Body1: Someone you’ve been near has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app. You were close to them for 15 minutes or more.
CA.Body2: You’re at risk of being infected. Watch yourself carefully for symptoms, and

ON.Title: You’ve been exposed in the last 14 days
ON.Body1: Someone you’ve been near has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app. You were close to them for 15 minutes or more.
ON.Body2: You’re at risk of being infected.

DiagnosedView.Title: Thanks for helping fight COVID-19

Body1.One: Tomorrow, you’ll get your last notification asking permission to upload any new random codes your phone sent out.
Body1.Other: For the next {number} days, you’ll get a daily notification asking permission to upload any new random codes your phone sent out.

DiagnosedView.Body2: You do not have to agree, even if you agreed the day before.
DiagnosedView.Body3: Take care of yourself and your family during this time.
DiagnosedView.TipBody: You can prepare for your call from Public Health through the test results website.

DiagnosedShareView.Title: Upload random codes
DiagnosedShareView.Body1: Thanks for helping slow the spread!
DiagnosedShareView.Body3: To help keep people safe, you need to upload your random codes every day, especially if you have to leave your home.

Home.EnableBluetoothCTA: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so COVID Alert can work.
Home.ExposureNotificationsDisabledDetailed: You did not enable COVID Alert. The app needs your permission to work.
Home.NoConnectivityDetailed: COVID Alert only checks for exposure if your phone is connected to the Internet.

OverlayOpen.BluetoothCardBody: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so COVID Alert can work.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBody: You need an 8-digit number to let people know they’ve been exposed.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBodyDiagnosed: Thank you for doing your part to slow the spread.
OverlayOpen.NotificationCardBody: You will not receive push notifications if you've been near anyone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis. Finding out potential exposures right away is essential to slowing the spread of COVID-19.
OverlayOpen.ExposureNotificationCardBody: COVID Alert cannot notify you as soon as it learns of a possible exposure. Finding out right away is essential to slowing the spread of COVID-19.

Tutorial.step-1AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone in a pocket, sending and receiving signals.
Tutorial.step-1:
The app runs in the background and will not interrupt your activities.

Whenever you’re near someone else with COVID Alert, both phones exchange random codes every 5 minutes.

The random codes change often and cannot be used to identify you.
Tutorial.step-2AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of 2 mobile phones side-by-side with a timer clock connecting both phones.
Tutorial.step-2:
The app estimates how near people are from the strength of Bluetooth signals.

If you’re closer than 2 metres for more than 15 minutes, the app will record an exposure.
Tutorial.step-3AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone uploading a numeric code to a cloud.
Tutorial.step-3:
If someone with the app is diagnosed with COVID-19, they can choose to upload the random codes their phone sent. The codes go into a central server.

The server only gets the codes. It does not get any information about the person.
Tutorial.step-4AltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone uploading a numeric code to a cloud.
Tutorial.step-4:
Every day, whenever it has an Internet connection, your phone will get a list of the random codes from people who reported a diagnosis.

If it finds codes that match, the app notifies you that you've been exposed and gives you guidance.

Sharing.Title: Tell your friends about COVID Alert
Sharing.SubTitle: Every person using COVID Alert helps to slow the spread of COVID-19. Sharing this app will not share any of your personal information.
Sharing.Message: Join me in helping to slow the spread of COVID-19. Download the COVID Alert app: https://covidshield.app

Start.Title: Together, let’s stop the spread of COVID-19
Start.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration with lots of different people in it. Dotted lines show their paths crossing and leading to a smartphone below.
Start.Body1: COVID Alert helps us break the cycle of infection. The app can let people know of possible exposures before any symptoms appear.
Start.Body2: That way, we can take care of ourselves and protect our communities.

WhatItsNot.Title: What COVID Alert does not do
WhatItsNot.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration with many houses and a high-rise building on a curving street. Small message bubbles appear above each home.
WhatItsNot.Body1: The app will not tell you in the moment if you’re currently near someone who’s been diagnosed.
WhatItsNot.Body2: It will not tell you about outbreaks in your community.

Anonymous.Title: Your privacy is safe
Anonymous.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of shaded glasses and hat to go incognito. Above the hat, a location pin icon is crossed out.
Anonymous.Body1: COVID Alert does not use GPS or location services.
Anonymous.Body2: It has no way of knowing:
Anonymous.Bullet5: The health information of anyone you’re near.

HowItWorks.Title: How it works
HowItWorks.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of 3 mobile phones sending out random codes via bluetooth.
HowItWorks.Body1: The app uses Bluetooth to exchange random codes with nearby phones.
HowItWorks.Body2: Every day, it checks a list of random codes from people who tell the app they tested positive.
HowItWorks.Body3: If you’ve been near one of those codes in the past 14 days, you’ll get a notification.
HowItWorks.HowItWorksCTA: Learn more about how it works

Permissions.Title: The app will now ask your permission
Permissions.ImageAltText: A hand-drawn illustration of a mobile phone displaying a dialogue box with a red X and a green check mark on the screen.
Permissions.Body1: Allow the app to start logging random codes or “random IDs” when you’re near other phones. The app will access the date, duration and signal strength related to the random codes, but they never leave your phone.
Permissions.Body2: You’ll also need to enable push notifications.

ThankYou.Title: Thank you for helping
ThankYou.Body: Exposure notifications are on. You will receive a message if COVID Alert detects that you've been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.

DataUpload.InfoSmall: Your random codes will not be uploaded unless you give permission in the next step.

Step1.Title: Let people know they may have been exposed
Step1.Body1b: Enter the number you got when you were diagnosed.
Step1.Body2b: Agree that COVID Alert can let people know they were exposed.
Step1.Body3b: Allow your phone to share your random codes anonymously.

FormView.Title: Enter your 8-digit number
FormView.Body: Enter the number you got when you were diagnosed.
FormView.ErrorBody: Your COVID Alert number could not be recognized. Please try again.

ConsentView.Title: Now you can upload your codes
ConsentView.Body1: Your phone will ask your permission to upload your random codes or “random IDs” from the past 14 days.
ConsentView.Body2a: Nobody will get any information about you
ConsentView.Body2b: or the time you were near them.
ConsentView.Body3: You can help slow the spread of COVID-19 if you agree.
ConsentView.ErrorTitle: Random codes could not be uploaded

NoRegion.Title: You skipped choosing province or territory
NoRegion.Body:
In some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

To find out if you can get an 8-digit number, you need to choose your area.

ON.Title: Get an 8-digit number
ON.Body: If you’ve tested positive in Ontario:
ON.Body2: Go to the COVID-19 Test Results Website and enter your details.
ON.Body5: Come back here and enter the number.
ON.CTA: Go to COVID-19 Test Results Website

RegionNotCovered.Title: No reporting yet in your area
RegionNotCovered.Body:
People in your area cannot yet get an 8-digit number.

You will not be able to let people know they were exposed. But you can still self-isolate for 14 days, and:
RegionNotCovered.Body3: Protect people and pets you live with.

Notification.ExposedMessageBody: You’ve been near someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app. Read guidance.
Notification.OffMessageBody: Turn on COVID Alert to get notified if you've been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.
Notification.DailyUploadNotificationBody: Help slow the spread of COVID-19 and upload your new random codes.

BottomSheet.OnStatus: COVID Alert is on, Tap for more information
BottomSheet.OffStatus: COVID Alert is off, Tap for more information

RegionLanding.Title: Choose your province or territory
RegionLanding.Body1: Provincial and territorial governments are working to support COVID Alert across Canada.
RegionLanding.Body2: In some places, people cannot yet report a COVID-19 diagnosis through this app.

RegionPicker.Title: Where do you live? (optional)
RegionPicker.Body:
Choose your region to check if you can report a diagnosis through this app.

Your region will never be shared with anyone.

HowToIsolate.Title: How to self-isolate
HowToIsolate.Body1: Stay home unless it’s to get medical care.
HowToIsolate.Body2: Avoid public transportation like buses or taxis.
HowToIsolate.Body3: Ask for help to get groceries and supplies dropped off at your door.
HowToIsolate.Body4: Stay in a separate room and use a separate bathroom from others in your home, if possible.
HowToIsolate.Body5: Wear a mask safely any time you cannot take the above actions.

Privacy.Title: Privacy policy
Privacy.Body1: COVID Alert is built with strong privacy protection.
Privacy.Body2: It's extremely unlikely that you could be identified while using this app. The COVID Alert app takes extensive steps, described below, to ensure your privacy and data are protected.

List1.Title: What the app collects and stores on your phone
List1.ListItem1: Random codes from your phone, for 14 days.
List1.ListItem2: Random codes from other phones near you, for 14 days.

Privacy.Body3: The random codes are only stored and used for the purpose of notifying you, or others, of possible COVID-19 exposure.

List2.Title: How the data is protected
List2.ListItem1: The app cannot connect your identity with the random codes.
List2.ListItem2: Your phone encrypts the random codes. You must give your permission before your phone will share the random codes with COVID Alert.

List3.Title: COVID Alert has no way of knowing

List4.Title: What the app shares
List4.SubTitle: Nothing is done without your permission.
List4.ListItem1: Nothing is shared without your explicit permission.
List4.ListItem2: Even when you give permission, the only information that's shared is the random codes from your phone.
List4.ListItem3: Only the app and its servers will have access to the random codes.

List5.Title: If you're diagnosed with COVID-19
List5.ListItem1: You can choose to share your random codes from the past 14 days with a central server.
List5.ListItem2: If you share your random codes, nobody will get any information about you or the time you were near them.
List5.ListItem3: You'll be asked for permission to upload your random codes for 13 days after.

List6.Title: If a person you were near reports a diagnosis through the app
List6.ListItem1: No information about you is shared with anyone.
List6.ListItem2: You will not receive any information about anyone else, not even someone you were in contact with who reports a diagnosis through the app.

List7.Title: Deleting your data
List7.ListItem1: All random codes, whether from your phone or others, are deleted after 15 days.
List7.ListItem2: You can delete the app at any time, and the random codes on your phone will be automatically deleted.
List7.ListItem3: If you had uploaded your random codes before deleting the app, the random codes will be deleted from the server after 15 days.

Privacy.Body4: Your health information stays with your provincial or territorial healthcare provider. COVID Alert does not know who you are and cannot access your health information.

List8.ListItem1: The 8-digit number provided by your healthcare provider tells COVID Alert that you can upload your random codes.
List8.ListItem2: COVID Alert trusts this number. The app uses this number so it does not have to collect any personal information that could identify you.
List8.ListItem3: Healthcare workers have no way to provide your personal information to COVID Alert.
List8.ListItem4: To protect the integrity of the 8-digit numbers provided by your healthcare provider, your province may generate a long internal identification number assuring that the 8-digit number was generated by a valid source. The Government of Canada is not able to associate these internal identification numbers to you or other app users, and they are only used when needed to prevent cybersecurity threats.

List9.ListItem1: As a security measure, if you enter an incorrect 8-digit number, the app will store your IP address for five minutes. The app does this to protect against bad actors.
List9.ListItem2: Without these security protections in place, spammers could flood the COVID Alert system and your phone with fake exposure notifications.
List9.ListItem3: Your IP address is never connected to any other information about you, and it’s only used to ensure the integrity of the system.
